snippet: An appeals panel ruled on Wednesday that requiring children to be vaccinated before attending public school does not violate their constitutional rights.
abstract: Manhattan appeals court rules that New York State's requirement that children be vaccinated before attending public school does not violate their constitutional rights; upholds previous decision that children with religious exemptions from immunizations can be barred from school when anther child has disease preventable by vaccine.
lead_paragraph: An appeals panel ruled on Wednesday that requiring children to be vaccinated before attending public school does not violate their constitutional rights.

headline.main: New York Vaccine Requirement Is Lawful, a 2nd Court Says
headline.print_headline: State Vaccine Requirement Is Lawful, a 2nd Court Says
